Yes, companies can also offer gym memberships or fitness classes in their wellness programs to encourage physical activity among employees. Providing opportunities for physical activity can help employees boost their energy levels, reduce stress and risk of chronic diseases, increase productivity, improve mood, and maintain a healthy weight.

Companies can explore various options to promote physical activity among employees such as offering on-site fitness classes, organizing company sports teams or tournaments, or providing discounted gym memberships or gym equipment in the workplace. Additionally, companies can encourage employees to take physical activity breaks during the workday, like walking meetings, stretching exercises, or workout sessions.

By promoting physical activity in the workplace, companies can create a culture of health and wellness, create a sense of community among employees, and improve overall workplace morale.
